data.title: South China Sea: Latest News and Updates
data.meta_description: Latest news on the South China Sea, including South China Sea conflict, South China Sea dispute, the Philippines, and China military updates.
data.text:
Instead of aligning with one superpower against another, the Philippines is bent on enhancing its own strategic agency in world affairs.

Release of Taiwanese and Indonesian fishermen the latest development in series of combative fishing-related incidents between Beijing and Taipei.

Manila also said a provisional agreement with China on resupply missions for troops at the Second Thomas Shoal would be reviewed.

Predicting typhoons is a matter of life or mass death yet it is backed by imperfect science. So, how have the boffins at the Hong Kong Observatory been rising to the challenge?

The vessel was one of the attractions in a show of freshly acquired tech that also included underwater drones.

Manila’s assertive approach contrasts with Hanoi’s “low profile” way of dealing with their respective South China Sea rows, analysts say.

Tokyo’s military drills with Manila and defence equipment agreement with Vietnam will have China taking notice, observers say.

PLA says it ‘dispelled’ a transport plane while Manila says Chinese jets endangered its pilots.

Following the drills off Manila, the Philippines says it will send a ship to Vietnam later this year to boost maritime cooperation.

US-made King Air 350ER expands search and rescue radius from 200 to 1,000 nautical miles as China pushes to develop maritime industries.

The drill involving the M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket System was partly based on a potential South China Sea conflict, analysts say.

Canadian Defence Minister Bill Blair says the two nations needed to work more closely together to maintain order in the Indo-Pacific.
